fields.description:
The links in recently updated macro are broken in HTML space export.

Other links in the page work correctly.

See screenshots:
- [^works.png]
- [^does not work.png]
fields.summary: recently updated macro links are broken in html space export

fields.description:
Same as CONF-16168 but specifically for default Websphere installs.

The fix for CONF-16168 does not apply to Websphere as it adds a {{no-cache=set-cookie}} header by default. You can apparently turn this default off by using a configuration property:
{{CookiesConfigureNoCache}}

Helpful Links:
* http://fixunix.com/websphere/210698-preventing-ibm-http-server-adding-response-headers-pdf-problem.html
* http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=180&uid=swg1PK20531
* http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/wasinfo/v4r0/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.support.waszos40.doc/html/Servlet_Engine_Web_Container/swg21104733.html
fields.summary: Websphere - File downloads over SSL don't work with cache control in IE browser

fields.description:
A customer mentioned that this functionality is important to have for automation and integration purposes.

Currently {{confluence-administrators}} are not able to discover restricted pages, despite of their ability to access (ie. read) the page if they know the url.

The customer argued that "this makes very little sense in general, given the "restricted pages" space admin view that ultimately makes the entire point moot."
fields.summary: Allow Site Admin to discover restricted pages

fields.description:
On system startup, dump the system information to the logs. That way if someone submits logfiles as part of a support case, we're more likely to have some useful system info included with them,

This info should include the list of installed plugins.
fields.summary: Log system info on startup

fields.description:
I opened a page for editing, and got the following OK alert, twice:
(actually, at seemingly regular intervals - say every 1 minute?)

!http://img.skitch.com/20090630-nqtdtn2u98us5k2ft3yewdqnmr.jpg!


Since revisiting the tab with CAC open, I noticed the following text had appeared in red: "Draft saving timed out".

I am still getting the OK popup.
fields.summary: OK Alert dialog appears while editing a page (Safari 4)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16235].
  {panel}

right now, if the viewppt macro is used in a feed, it prints this message:
You need flash player installed to preview ppt and pdf files
Get Adobe Flash player

but i do have flash player and can see the ppt in the page if i visit it in confluence rather than just in the feed. the macro [should detect its context|http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2009/06/how_to_determine_the_context_y.html] and show a better message when in a feed. something about how flash probably can't be used there but if you visit the original page it might be displayed
fields.summary: viewppt macro should have better message when rendered in a feed

fields.description: User Hover is not working for a username which contains a space.  The result is a thin bar with no info.
fields.summary: User Hover is not working for a username which contains a space

fields.description:
The documentation provides information about locating missing attachments using a JSP script:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Resolve+Missing+Attachments+in+Confluence

The existing script doesn't work with Confluence 3.0 since [attachment storage has been restructured|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hierarchical+File+System+Attachment+Storage].

Attached is an updated script which works for Confluence 3.0.  Please replace the existing attachment.
fields.summary: Documentation for missing attachments needs to be updated...

fields.description:
Users whose selected system language is spanish or french get the "Unable to render content due to system error: null" message for some parts of  page content (especially links).

In comparison to this, users with german or english language can display the same content properly. Please find an example attached.

Hint: It depends not on missing permissions. You can prove this by using the same user switching over to different languages.

Please fix this problem as soon as possible, because this prevents my company from executing further rollouts to Spain and France.

Thanks,
Martin
fields.summary: Spanish / french Language Pack: Unable to render content due to system error: null

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16231].
  {panel}

Hi,
We have some Confluence users who are using IE7/Firefox.
Issue is that Confluence pages having long contents are not showing complete page contents. 
Please refer attachment for sample review and help to sort out the issue.

Thanks,
Abhishek
fields.summary: IE7 not showing complete Confluence page contents

fields.description:
I wanted to test Confluence 3.0 so I downloaded confluence-3.0.0_01-std.zip, extracted it and ran it, as usual. I told Confluence to install the Standard Site and HSQL. 
Afterwards, when I first saw the Demonstration Space it showed many errors of missing macros (plugins). The Dashboard shows many missing macros as well.
I can't even easily access the Administration Menu, because the Javascript libraries are missing. I was able to access the Administration Menu over the known URL for the Admin-Menu. Still, like this, I can't really test the new version, since it even misses the plugin repository and I'm not able to install missing plugins for macros.

This error seems  to have slipped through quality assurance - or am I doing something wrong?
fields.summary: Crucial Plugins/Macros not installed by default on Confluence 3.0 Standalone with Standard-Site

fields.description:
There is a {{web-resource}} plugin type for Confluence that allows you to have a resource included on every html page or only in certain contexts. This only seems to be working for the default theme. All other bundled themes are not honoring this plugin type.

For example, the office connector has the following xml snippet specified in its atlassian-plugin.xml:
{code:XML}
<web-resource key="editinoffice" name="Edit in Office javascript resource" >
     <resource type="download" name="editInOffice.js" location="templates/extra/editinword/editInOffice.js" />
     <context>page</context>
     <dependency>confluence.web.resources:jquery</dependency>
     <dependency>confluence.web.resources:ajs</dependency>
 </web-resource>
{code}

This tells confluence to include the editInOffice.js file when a user is viewing a Confluence page. This works for the default theme but not for Clickr and the Left Navigation theme.
fields.summary: Some bundled themes don't support web resource injection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16222]. {panel} Hello, email notifications contain tags that some MUAs (Eg. Lotus Notes) fail to interpret correctly. In particular the "{{
}}" could be "{{
}}" as per the "[C.2. Empty Elements|http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/#C_2]" paragraph of section "C. HTML Compatibility Guidelines" of the [XHTML W3C Recommendation 1.0|http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/] Best Regards, Edoardo
fields.summary: HTML compatibility in XHTML 1.0 emails sent by Confluence could be improved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16221].
  {panel}

Hello,

Customers using Lotus Notes MUA will be affected by the same problem described in [JRA-12151]: Lotus Notes fails to correctly render HTML emails where entities are specified in -numeric- hexadecimal rather than named format (ref [HTML ISO-8859-1 Reference|http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_entities.asp]).

A similar patch as the one devised for JIRA should be devised for Confluence as well.


Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: HTML entities in emails rendered incorrectly by Lotus Notes

fields.description:
From CONF-16131, which is caused by this problem.

RemovePagePermissionAction, for remove page permissions via one of the View Info screen's "open padlock" links, is not a SpaceAdministrative action. When the remove succeeds, the user is redirected to listpermissionpages -> ListPermissionPagesAction which *is* SpaceAdministrative.

Thus, if the user has permission to remove a permission on a page but not space admin permission, they will see the "Not Permitted" screen (e.g. for me, https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/listpermissionpages.action?key=PM).

The remove success either needs to redirect to a screen the user has permission to view, or (preferably) use AJAX to perform the removal without leaving the View Info screen.
fields.summary: Remove page permission from View Info screen redirects to Space "listpermissionpages" on success but user might not have permission for that screen

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create wiki markup with the following lines, with the image attached:
{code}
The following image is an attachment:
!gold-star.png!
The following image is a direct link from a website: 
!http://www.astro.washington.edu/images/gold-star.png!
{code}
# Click Edit in Word link
# Save and close the Word Document
# Refresh your browser for the changes

Notice that the wiki markup that inserts the second image is missing totally. The source for the image is a fully qualified url. The expected result is to at least retain the code if Word could not render it. These are the wiki markup after the edit:

{code}
The following image is an attachment:
!gold-star.png!
The following image is a direct link from a website: 
\\
{code}

Attached are some screenshots depicting this.

# [Edit in Word|^EditInWord.png]
# [After Edit|^AfterEdit.png]

# This is step no4
# This is step no5

# This is step no8
{code}

# Refresh your browser to see the changes

Notice that the list numbering gets restarted and line breaks were added before the macro, hence breaking the list numbering. These are the wiki markup after the edit:

# This is step no1
# This is step no2
# This is step no3
# This is step no4
# This is step no5
# *Create a new line*
# \\

{quote}
{loremipsum}
{quote}
# This is step no6
# This is step no7
# This is step no8
{code}

Attached are some screenshots depicting this.
# [The original page|^BeforeEdit.png]
# [Edit in Word|^EditInWord.png] - notice the line breaks
# [After Edit|^AfterEditNumberRestarted.png]

fields.description:
As a workaround for CONF-9623, we have code in the CSUM plugin ( http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Custom+Space+User+Management+Plugin ) that expects that a user that has the ability to remove all permissions from a group can also delete it.

However a user of Confluence 2.10.2 reported in http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/SUSR-97 that they have users setup without the right to delete a specific group (using UserAccessor.removeGroup(Group) fails on that group), however the CSUM plugin prior to that failed delete is able to remove all permissions from the group using SpacePermissionManager.removePermission(SpacePermission) as workaround for CONF-9623.

It seems a little strange that a user would have rights to remove all permissions from a group and then not be able to delete it. Can you reproduce this, and do you agree that this is a bug?

If not, and if this is intentional, then we should be able to re-add those permissions as that user, so I will try to add to the code to see if that helps. Another option if that doesn't work could be that we stop supporting Confluence 2.6.x for future versions of CSUM.
fields.summary: SpacePermissionManager.removePermission(SpacePermission) on group works to remove all perms as user even though user does not have rights to delete group via UserAccessor.removeGroup(Group)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16179].
  {panel}

If an article is positioned deep in the article hierarchy, the breadcrumb navigation link list is shortened by replacing some levels with an ellipsis.

This feature is however not used consistently: it is not used when showing the attachments page.

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=182157855
compared to http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewinfo.action?pageId=182157855
or http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Yet+another+Twitter+macro

We have a customer with a very deep page hierarchy and because the breadcrumb navigation is so long it completely wreaks the page design when the attachment page is viewed.

The viewpageattachments.action should use the same way of shortening the breadcrumb navigation link list as all the other pages.
fields.summary: inconsistent usage of shortened breadcrumbs navigation for an attchment page

While it is possible to upload a gif or png image as a Profile Picture, the image gets converted into a jpeg after upload. Because jpeg does not include support for transparency, it is not possible to use custom Profile Pictures which display as nicely as the built-in set.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Upload tux-transparent.gif as a Profile Picture
2. Note that although the file retains the .gif extension, it is now a jpeg, and its formerly transparent areas now display as black.

This issue is related to but not an exact duplicate of CONF-10901.
fields.summary: Do not convert gif/png Profile Pictures to jpeg

fields.description:
When you try to save an attachment over ssl in Internet Explorer, you may receive this [error message|^IEError.png]. See the sample header in the attached text file.

There is a bug reported in IE support site at http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;323308

A workaround in Confluence 2.10.x and below:
* Place these Valve elements in the Context element of conf/server.xml:
{noformat}
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.authenticator.FormAuthenticator" securePagesWithPragma="false" />
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.authenticator.NonLoginAuthenticator" securePagesWithPragma="false" /> 
{noformat}

*UPDATE for Confluence 3.x*:

This issue may still exists in Confluence 3.x, however, it is due to Tomcat configuration. If you are still encountering this issue, please add the same valve elements above to your Tomcat's server.xml.
fields.summary: File downloads over SSL don't work with cache control in IE browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16167].
  {panel}

The Confluence logfile configuration don't switch automatically after startup, even with the distributed log4j.properties. This is what happens
* after Startup, the /admin/viewlog4j.action Page shows in the table Existing Levels just two entries: org.apache.catalina.cluster and {root}}, both at INFO-level.
* after pressing [Production], the table is filled with loggers listed in the properties file. This configuration is used and may be changed (e.g in Level), also.

Turning log4j debugging reveals that:
* log4j will first try to lookup log4j.xml in the classpath. If this fail, it will lookup for log4j.properties
* Tomcat5.5 has it's own classloader branch for the Catalina engine, from that the application can't "see" this log4 configuration (usually at ../user/share/tomcat-5.5/server/lib/classes/)
* Tomcat6 uses a new (unified) classloader 
*  If one will declare the Tomcat logging configuration in XML and an Application uses the old property syntax, the wrong one will be choosen ("preferred").

This log4j documentation explains why this happens and suggests ways (eg JNDI {{comp/env}} lookups) to resolve: [Supporting the log4j RepositorySelector in Servlet Containers |http://www.qos.ch/logging/sc.jsp]



Regards,
Edoardo

fields.description:
h2. Summary of the bug

Create iframe using user macro with 3 params. $param0 indicates the src, $param1 indicates width and $param2 indicates the height. In the page where you use the macro, if the $param0 ( src ) contains parameters (particularly equals-to sign), the page cannot be displayed and throws Page Not Found in Confluence.

h3. How to reproduce

+Create a user macro with these parameters:+
Macro Name: myiframe
Macro has a body : Untick / Tick (Both)
Output: Macro generates HTML markup

Template:
<iframe src="$param0" width="$param1" height="$param2"></iframe>


+In the page:+

{myiframe:http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pwS2wRVw9u1dK1ujYw5AaAA|800|400} 

This will result in Page not Found (within Confluence). Click the [link|^UserMacroBug.png] for the image.


h3. Extra Findings

* When the URL is hardcoded in user macro, the external page is displayed correctly. Eg:

+User Macro+

<iframe src="http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pwS2wRVw9u1dK1ujYw5AaAA" width="$param0" height="$param1"></iframe>

+Page+

{myiframe:800|400} 


* The problem happens during the passing of parameters. Could be due to double equals-to sign. Eg: src="http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pwS2wRVw9u1dK1ujYw5AaAA"

* Page source indicates the $param0 is not expanded: <iframe src=$param0 width="800" height="400"></iframe>

* There is no problem if the user macro is tried within the {html} macro. Eg:

{html} 
<iframe src="http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pwS2wRVw9u1dK1ujYw5AaAA" width="800" height="600"></iframe>
{html}


h3. Workaround

Escape the equals to sign (=) with &\#61; Eg:

{noformat}
{myiframe:http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=pwS2wRVw9u1dK1ujYw5AaAA|800|400} 
{noformat}

The result is the expected result as indicated in this [image|^WorkaroundUserMacro.png]
fields.summary: User macro param doesn't work as expected for iframe

fields.description: The description of the type parameter on this macro requires updating. It currently says: Label => *Include these Content Types Only* Desc => *Separate each type with a comma or single space. Example: page,comment. If not specified, all content types are included.* However, using the *comment* value with this parameter is useless because comments cannot be labelled. I've removed this confusion from the documentation but it needs to be addressed by updating the wording in the macro browser. Suggestion is: Label => *Include this Content Type Only* Desc => *Examples: page or blogpost. If not specified, all content types are included.* Reason for this radical change -> although this parameter can take multiple values (from what I understand), there is no point in doing this because there are only two viable options for this parameter - page or blogpost/news.
fields.summary: Correction to the content by label wording on the macro browser is required. What's currently there is misleading.

fields.description:
Confluence allows its users to specify a "Profile Picture," an image that appears on many pages related to the user.  A user can either upload a custom image, or select one from a set provided by Confluence.  Confluence uses the /users/doeditmyprofilepicture.action path to process requests to change a user's Profile Picture.

The doeditmyprofilepicture.action hander does not sufficiently validate the contents of the userProfilePictureName parameter, however.  While Confluence does check the parameter to ensure that it begins with "/images/icons/profilepics/", which is the path to the built-in set of images, it does not reject ".." and similar strings.  As a result, a user can use directory traversal to specify any URL on the Confluence web server as his or her Profile Picture.

Many (all?) Confluence administrative tasks can be accomplished using GET requests, so there are URLs on the Confluence web server that correspond to many administrative tasks. For example, this path:

/admin/users/adduserstogroup.action?usersToAdd=joeschmo&membersOfGroupTerm=confluence-administrators

Adds user joeschmo to the Confluence administrators group.

In order for an attacker to gain administrative access, then, all he or she must do it specify the appropriate adduserstogroup.action URL as a Profile Picture, and wait for an administrator to view a page that displays the Profile Picture.  It should not be a very long wait, since many pages fit that description.

While Confluence 3.0 does not fix the validation of the userProfilePictureName parameter to doeditmyprofilepicture.action, it does
contain cross-site request forgery protection that makes exploiting it much more difficult.

All requests that actually "do things" require an additional parameter called atl_token, which is randomly generated and tied to a specific session.  Without knowledge of their values for this parameter, it is not possible to cause other users to carry out actions when viewing a page with your Profile Picture.

See also a draft security advisory I would eventually like to release:

http://userwww.service.emory.edu/~ekenda2/EMORY-2009-02.txt
fields.summary: Directory traversal in Profile Picture path - leads to privilege escalation in < 3.0
